column2: Jack wondered and mused within himself how he could get something for Christmas presents for his little sisters. He couldn't make anything at home without their seeing it
column3: nor at school without the teacher's seeing it
column4: or else the big boys plaguing him about it. Besides
column5: he would rather buy something pretty
column6: such as they had never seen before—china dolls in pink dresses
column7: or something of that kind. One morning
column9: Jack discovered some quail-tracks in the snow near the straw-stack
column10: and he no longer wondered about ways and means
column11: but in a moment was awake to the importance of this discovery. That very evening he made a wooden trap
column12: and the next morning early set it near the stack
column13: and laid an inviting train of wheat quite up to it
column14: and scattered a little inside. He told his sisters
column17: but not about what he meant to do with the quails when he caught them.
